Hi everyone!

I thought I would be on the receiving end of the Petrov this time against my Expert buddy Dave.  Things seemed to be going OK and then my kingside pawn structure got busted.  I then went into a K & P ending and Henry then got bogged down with disastrous results.  How does it happen?  Well, here we go .....
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: 2. ...... Nf6 - this move starts off the Petrov's defense.
moves.3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nf3 Nxe4 5. c4: 5. c4 - all fairly standard Petrov stuff so far!
moves.5... Nc6 6. d3 Nf6 7. d4 d5 8. Nc3: 8. Nc3 - out comes my queen knight.
moves.8... Bb4 9. Bd3 O-O 10. O-O: 10. 0-0 - after some development both kings get tucked away.
moves.13... Bh5 14. a3 Bxc3 15. bxc3: 15. bxc3 - was Rxc3 better?  Gameknot Analysis does not have anything to tell me here.  Except that my score is -0.26.
moves.19... Rae8 20. Rfe1: 20. Rfe1 - I do not like that doubling up of black heavies on the e column, time to get rid of 'em.
moves.20... Bxf3 21. Rxe7 Rxe7 22. Qxf3 Qxf3 2: 23. gxf3 - so here it is, my kingside pawn structure is busted.  Gameknot Analysis gives my score in the position as -0.47.  My position has gone downhill a bit since the exchange of N for B on c3 on move 15.
moves.23... f6 24. Kf1 Kf7 25. Re1: 25. Re1 - thought I would challenge the e column.

Hmm, in that Best Line my position does look drawish there with the ability to move Fou Lenoir freely.  My position is about to go further south.
moves.27... Nf5 28. d5 Nd6 29. Bxd6 cxd6: 29. ..... cxd6 - after this trade the computer gave my score as -1.35 so it is certainly gradually getting worse all the while.

Even in the best continuation white is lost here.
moves.35... h6 36. h4 h5: 36. ....... h5 - here I am in a zugzwang.  There is no way I can avoid losing my f4 pawn for starters.  Gameknot gives my score as  -9.55 which is more than a whole queen down so the resignation is justified.  The moral and the lesson here is, if your pawn structure is busted there is even less room for innaccuracies, especially when playing against somebody of near-master strength!
